output_list.reason: The mintToken function allows an attacker to mint an arbitrary amount of tokens owned by the attacker, due to a lack of overflow checks in the addition of balances.
The transfer function allows a user to transfer tokens to a contract that has a fallback function, causing a loss of tokens.
The approve function does not check if the spender is a smart contract, allowing attackers to exploit the smart contract.
The transferFrom function does not check if the spender is a smart contract, allowing attackers to exploit the smart contract.
The claimThrone function has predictable winner selection, allowing attackers to exploit the smart contract.
